body: This appears to be a time of check, time of use issue in the JDK. I'll see whether I can fix it there.
@fmeum were you able to establish that the issue is in the JVM and not Bazel? Should this be closed?

@tjgq The JDK calls the method twice, once to check for `null`, once on the line that triggers the NPE. While I haven't been able to confirm that the method can return different return values, this looks like the likely source of the bug.

Since waiting for a JDK release with a fix will take a while anyway, should we catch the exception in Bazel?
@Ryang20718 Have you seen this exact exception occur multiple times?
@tjgq yes Iâ€™ve seen it occur multiple times
I think it's reasonable to handle it gracefully on the Bazel side, then. It's just profiling logic, so occasionally swallowing an error shouldn't compromise correctness.

issue.title: Guard against NPE when calling `OperatingSystemMXBean.getCpuLoad()`

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This guards against an ineffective `null` check in the JDK.

Also use `getCpuLoad()` instead of `getSystemCpuLoad()` as the latter has been deprecated.

Fixes #24519

issue.title: [8.0.0] Guard against NPE when calling `OperatingSystemMXBean.getCpuLoad()`

repository.name: bazel

Also use `getCpuLoad()` instead of `getSystemCpuLoad()` as the latter has been deprecated.

Fixes #24519

Closes #24569.
